sources.title: That Uncertain Feeling
sources.description: Against her better judgement, happily married Jill Baker (Merle Oberon) is persuaded to see a popular psychoanalyst about her psychosomatic hiccups

sources.title: That Uncertain Feeling (1941) MELVYN DOUGLAS ♥ MERLE OBERON
sources.description:
♣ HIGH DEFINITION UPGRADE ♣
Director: Ernst Lubitsch
Stars: Merle Oberon, Melvyn Douglas
Co-Starring: Burgess Meredith, Eve Arden, Alan Mowbray
In this romantic comedy by the sophisticated and elegant Ernst Lubitsch, a pair of New York City socialites' marriage hits the rocks after a visit to a psychoanalyst. Produced in between the director’s finest “The Shop Around the Corner” and “Heaven Can Wait. Prepare to be entertained.

sources.title: That Uncertain Feeling (1941) Burgess Meredith | Comedy Classic Film
sources.description:
Strictly for Laughing Purposes Only!
A psychoanalyst causes a woman to doubt her happy marriage.

Director: Ernst Lubitsch
Writers: Donald Ogden Stewart, Walter Reisch 
Stars: Merle Oberon, Melvyn Douglas, Burgess Meredith
Genres: Classics, Comedy

metadata.Plot: Against her better judgement, happily married Jill Baker is persuaded to see a popular psychoanalyst about her psychosomatic hiccups. Soon, she's disillusioned about husband Larry; and one day in the doctor's waiting room she meets pianist Alexander Sebastian, who's even more confused than she is. Can this marriage be saved? Larry has a plan that is pure Lubitsch...
metadata.Writer: Donald Ogden Stewart, Walter Reisch, Victorien Sardou
metadata.Actors: Merle Oberon, Melvyn Douglas, Burgess Meredith
